Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in concluding applicants were not Convention refugees or persons in need of protection
Credibility_Assessment: Principal applicant's inconsistent statements undermined credibility
Evidence_Type: Credible evidence of state protection in Peru, internal flight alternative in Lima
Legal_Provision: IRPA - Lack of state protection, absence of valid internal flight alternative (IFA)
Basis_of_Claim: Persecution by Shining Path and Peruvian anti-terrorist police (DINCOTE)
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Credibility issues, availability of state protection, existence of IFA
Application_Factor: Credibility, state protection, internal flight alternative
Decision_Review_Issue: Did the Board err in its refugee determination?
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA provisions on Convention refugee status and person in need of protection
Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credible persecution claims, availability of state protection, viable IFA
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA sections related to refugee protection and IFA
Credibility_Issues: Yes - inconsistent statements regarding threats and persecution
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of Board’s decision
